docs.lead_paragraph: Mary Medina first sought treatment for depression at Northwest Mental Health Center in Chicago after her son, who had joined the Army following the Sept. 11 attacks, had been sent to Iraq. ''He's in the Army and in Iraq and I didn't know when I was going to see him or talk to him or if he's even alive,'' she said. ''That's how bad things are. And when you're uncertain about your life, it really hits home.''

docs.lead_paragraph: By competing to be the “most conservative,” the Republican candidates diminish their appeal to a broad electorate.

headline.seo: The Republican Candidates’ Race to the Right

docs.abstract: Editorial scores leading Republican presidential candidates overtly jockeying to be the favorite of right-wing extremists; contends that as they battle for the title of Most Conservative, distorting their own records and advocating increasingly radical positions, they lose their appeal to a broad electorate.
docs.snippet: By competing to be the “most conservative,” the Republican candidates diminish their appeal to a broad electorate.

docs.lead_paragraph: I was going to write something snarky about the attempt at self-justification, but on second thought I'll just lay it out straight.

headline.main: The Wyden-Ryan Plan: Déjà Vu All Over Again

docs.abstract: The much-discussed Wyden-Ryan plan offers no new vision for containing health-care costs and relies on unproven hyptheses, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: The nurses are to strike Jan. 3 at St. Luke’s-Roosevelt Hospital, while negotiations continue at Mount Sinai and Montefiore hospitals.

headline.seo: Nurses at St. Luke’s-Roosevelt Hospital to Strike Jan. 3
headline.main: Nurses Plan Walkout at St. Luke’s-Roosevelt
headline.print_headline: Nurses Plan Walkout at St. Luke’s-Roosevelt

docs.abstract: New York State Nursing Association says that nurses at St Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital plan to go on strike on Jan 3 unless last-ditch negotiations succeed in bridging divide over wages.
docs.snippet: The nurses are to strike Jan. 3 at St. Luke’s-Roosevelt Hospital, while negotiations continue at Mount Sinai and Montefiore hospitals.

docs.lead_paragraph: The obstructionism used by Republicans crumbled as the struggle to reach a deal on a payroll tax cut showed voters the real temperament of the current House leadership.

headline.seo: The House Backs Down on the Payroll Tax Cut

docs.abstract: Editorial asserts that the struggle in Congress over whether to extend a payroll tax cut and unemployment benefits has exposed voters in the starkest way to the obstructionist temperament of the Republican-controlled House; says impasse lays bare the limits of Republican brinkmanship.
docs.snippet: The obstructionism used by Republicans crumbled as the struggle to reach a deal on a payroll tax cut showed voters the real temperament of the current House leadership.
